intro: Allophylus bongolavensis, commonly known as the Madagascar hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. Allophylus bongolavensis is adapted to the tropical climate of Madagascar and is often found in humid, forested areas.
